snippet: The Islamist extremist group Al Mourabitoun is said to be joining Al Qaeda’s North Africa branch.
abstract: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb announces merger with Al Mourabitoun, Islamic extremist group which claimed responsibility for attack on Bamako, Mali, hotel that killed 20 people.
lead_paragraph: The Islamist extremist group Al Mourabitoun is said to be joining Al Qaeda’s North Africa branch.

headline.main: Mali: Group Merges With Al Qaeda
headline.print_headline: Africa; Mali: Militants Merge With Al Qaeda
